events.title: Napoleon Bonaparte crowns himself Emperor of the French
events.description: Napoleon Bonaparte crowned himself Emperor in Notre Dame Cathedral in Paris, marking the rise of the First French Empire.
events.significance: This event signaled the consolidation of power under Napoleon and the establishment of a new political order in France.

events.title: Monroe Doctrine is proclaimed
events.description: U.S. President James Monroe announced the Monroe Doctrine, declaring opposition to European colonialism in the Americas.
events.significance: The doctrine shaped U.S. foreign policy by asserting the Western Hemisphere as a sphere of influence and warning European powers against intervention.

events.title: The first controlled nuclear chain reaction takes place
events.description: Under the leadership of Enrico Fermi, the Chicago Pile-1 achieved the first self-sustaining nuclear chain reaction.
events.significance: This breakthrough marked the beginning of nuclear energy and atomic weapons development.

events.title: The United States government orders the top-secret Operation Wetback
events.description: Operation Wetback was launched to deport illegal Mexican immigrants from the southwestern United States.
events.significance: The operation had significant social and demographic impacts on U.S.-Mexico relations and immigration policy.
